acf-compatibility-name.name: acf/compatibility/{$name}
acf-compatibility-name.summary: Enable specific backwards compatibility logic with dynamic name
acf-compatibility-name.description: This filter allows you to modify ACF compatibility settings which are used throughout the plugin.

acf-compatibility.name: acf/compatibility
acf-compatibility.description: This filter allows you to modify ACF compatibility settings which are used throughout the plugin.

acf-fields-google_map-api.name: acf/fields/google_map/api
acf-fields-google_map-api.summary: Customize the URL parameters used to load Google Maps JS.
acf-fields-google_map-api.description: This filter allows you to modify the URL parameters used to load Google Maps JS. Its primary use is to allow a Google API key to be set, however, may also be used to customize other_params used in the google.load function.

api.label: api
api.description: an array of all API info detailed below

acf-format_value-type-field_type.name: acf/format_value/type={$field_type}
acf-format_value-type-field_type.summary: Customize the value when it is called from a template function such as get_field(). Filter for a specific field based on it’s type.
acf-format_value-type-field_type.description: This filter is applied to the $value after it is loaded from the db and before it is returned to the template via functions such as get_field().

value.label: value
value.description: The value which was loaded from the database.

post_id.label: post_id
post_id.description: The post ID from which the value was loaded.

field.label: field
field.description: An array containing all the field settings for the field which was used to upload the attachment.

acf-format_value.summary: Customize the value when it is called from a template function such as get_field(). Filter for every field.

value.label: value
value.description: The value which was loaded from the database.

post_id.label: post_id
post_id.description: The post ID from which the value was loaded.

field.label: field
field.description: An array containing all the field settings for the field which was used to upload the attachment.

acf-pre_save_post.name: acf/pre_save_post
acf-pre_save_post.summary: Customize the $post_id used to save data during the acf_form_head() function.
acf-pre_save_post.description:
This filter allows you to modify the $post_id before any custom field data is saved from the front end form (acf_form()). This filter is used in the tutorial Using acf_form to create a new post.

This filter is not required to create a new post due to the new_post argument added to acf_form() in v5.0.0

post_id.label: post_id
post_id.description: The post ID to which all the $_POST data (values) will be saved to.

acf-prepare_field-key-field_key.name: acf/prepare_field/key={$field_key}
acf-prepare_field-key-field_key.summary: Customize the field after its value is loaded (before field is rendered for input). Filter for a specific field based on it’s name.
acf-prepare_field-key-field_key.description:
This filter allows you to modify a field right before it is rendered onto the page. By this time, the field has been validated and it’s value loaded.

You may also use this filter to prevent the field from being rendered in a form. To do this, return false instead of an array.

field.label: field
field.description: The field settings array. This can be modified and then returned.

acf-prepare_field-name-field_name.name: acf/prepare_field/name={$field_name}
acf-prepare_field-name-field_name.summary: Customize the field after its value is loaded (before field is rendered for input). Filter for a specific field based on it’s name.
acf-prepare_field-name-field_name.description:
This filter allows you to modify a field right before it is rendered onto the page. By this time, the field has been validated and it’s value loaded.

You may also use this filter to prevent the field from being rendered in a form. To do this, return false instead of an array.

field.label: field
field.description: The field settings array. This can be modified and then returned.

acf-prepare_field-type-field_type.summary: Customize the field after its value is loaded (before field is rendered for input). Filter for a specific field based on it’s type.
acf-prepare_field-type-field_type.description:

You may also use this filter to prevent the field from being rendered in a form. To do this, return false instead of an array.

field.label: field
field.description: The field settings array. This can be modified and then returned.

acf-upload_prefilter-key-field_key.name: acf/upload_prefilter/key={$field_key}
acf-upload_prefilter-key-field_key.summary: Perform custom validation on an attachment before it is uploaded. Filter for a specific field based on it’s key.
acf-upload_prefilter-key-field_key.description: This filter allows you to run custom validation on attachments before they are uploaded. The image, file and gallery field include settings to validate width, height, size and type for uploads, however you may find it necessary to add customized logic for all or specific upload fields.

value.label: value
value.description: The value of the field as found in the $_POST object.

post_id.label: post_id
post_id.description: The post id to save against.

field.label: field
field.description: The field object (actually an array, not object).

post_id.description: The post id to save against.

field.label: field
field.description: The field object (actually an array, not object).

acf-upload_prefilter.name: acf/upload_prefilter
acf-upload_prefilter.summary: Perform custom validation on an attachment before it is uploaded. Filter for every field.
acf-upload_prefilter.description: This filter allows you to run custom validation on attachments before they are uploaded. The image, file and gallery field include settings to validate width, height, size and type for uploads, however you may find it necessary to add customized logic for all or specific upload fields.

errors.label: errors
errors.description: An array of errors for the given file about to be uploaded. Appending to this array will result in the attachment failing to upload, and the error message displayed to the client.

file.label: file
file.description: An array containing the $_FILE data for the attachment about to be uploaded.

field.label: field
field.description: An array containing all the field settings for the field which was used to upload the attachment.

acf-validate_attachment-key-field_key.name: acf/validate_attachment/key={$field_key}
acf-validate_attachment-key-field_key.summary: Perform custom validation on an attachment before it is uploaded or selected. Filter for a specific field based on it’s key.
acf-validate_attachment-key-field_key.description: This filter allows you to run custom validation on attachments before they are uploaded. The image, file and gallery field include settings to validate width, height, size and type for uploads, however you may find it necessary to add customized logic for all or specific upload fields.

errors.label: errors
errors.description: An array of error messages (strings) for the given attachment. Appending to this array will result in the attachment failing to upload, and the error message displayed to the client.

file.label: file
file.description: An array of generic file data including type, width, height and size.

attachment.label: attachment
attachment.description: The attachment being uploaded/displayed. This data changes depending on context.

field.label: field
field.description: The field array containing all attributes & settings.

context.label: context
context.description: Description of the current context: upload, basic_upload (when uploading) or prepare (when viewing). Added in 5.6.3.

acf-validate_attachment-name-field_name.name: acf/validate_attachment/name={$field_name}
acf-validate_attachment-name-field_name.summary: Perform custom validation on an attachment before it is uploaded or selected. Filter for a specific field based on it’s name.
acf-validate_attachment-name-field_name.description: This filter allows you to run custom validation on attachments before they are uploaded. The image, file and gallery field include settings to validate width, height, size and type for uploads, however you may find it necessary to add customized logic for all or specific upload fields.

errors.label: errors
errors.description: An array of error messages (strings) for the given attachment. Appending to this array will result in the attachment failing to upload, and the error message displayed to the client.

file.label: file
file.description: An array of generic file data including type, width, height and size.

attachment.label: attachment
attachment.description: The attachment being uploaded/displayed. This data changes depending on context.

field.label: field
field.description: The field array containing all attributes & settings.

context.label: context
context.description: Description of the current context: upload, basic_upload (when uploading) or prepare (when viewing). Added in 5.6.3.

acf-validate_attachment-type-field_type.name: acf/validate_attachment/type={$field_type}
acf-validate_attachment-type-field_type.summary: Perform custom validation on an attachment before it is uploaded or selected. Filter for a specific field based on it’s type.
acf-validate_attachment-type-field_type.description: This filter allows you to run custom validation on attachments before they are uploaded. The image, file and gallery field include settings to validate width, height, size and type for uploads, however you may find it necessary to add customized logic for all or specific upload fields.

errors.label: errors
errors.description: An array of error messages (strings) for the given attachment. Appending to this array will result in the attachment failing to upload, and the error message displayed to the client.

file.label: file
file.description: An array of generic file data including type, width, height and size.

attachment.label: attachment
attachment.description: The attachment being uploaded/displayed. This data changes depending on context.

field.label: field
field.description: The field array containing all attributes & settings.

context.label: context
context.description: Description of the current context: upload, basic_upload (when uploading) or prepare (when viewing). Added in 5.6.3.

acf-validate_attachment.name: acf/validate_attachment
acf-validate_attachment.summary: Perform custom validation on an attachment before it is uploaded or selected. Filter for every field.
acf-validate_attachment.description:
This filter allows you to perform custom validation on an attachment and prevent it being uploaded or selected for a specific field.

Similar to the acf/upload_prefilter filter, this filter can be used to prevent an upload, however, it can also be used to prevent an attachment being selected from a WP media modal.

errors.label: errors
errors.description: An array of error messages (strings) for the given attachment. Appending to this array will result in the attachment failing to upload, and the error message displayed to the client.

file.label: file
file.description: An array of generic file data including type, width, height and size.

attachment.label: attachment
attachment.description: The attachment being uploaded/displayed. This data changes depending on context.

field.label: field
field.description: The field array containing all attributes & settings.

context.label: context
context.description: Description of the current context: upload, basic_upload (when uploading) or prepare (when viewing). Added in 5.6.3.

acf-validate_value-key-field_key.name: acf/validate_value/key={$field_key}
acf-validate_value-key-field_key.summary: Perform custom validation on a field's value before it is saved. Filter for a specific field based on it’s key.
acf-validate_value-key-field_key.description: This filter allows you to perform custom validation on a field’s value and either allow or prevent the post from being saved.

valid.label: valid
valid.description: Whether or not the value is valid (true / false). Can also be returned as a custom error message (string).

field.label: field
field.description: An array containing all the field settings.

acf-validate_value-name-field_name.name: acf/validate_value/name={$field_name}
acf-validate_value-name-field_name.summary: Perform custom validation on a field's value before it is saved. Filter for a specific field based on it’s name.
acf-validate_value-name-field_name.description: This filter allows you to perform custom validation on a field’s value and either allow or prevent the post from being saved.

valid.label: valid
valid.description: Whether or not the value is valid (true / false). Can also be returned as a custom error message (string).

field.label: field
field.description: An array containing all the field settings.

acf-validate_value-type-field_type.name: acf/validate_value/type={$field_type}
acf-validate_value-type-field_type.summary: Perform custom validation on a field's value before it is saved. Filter for a specific field based on it’s type.
acf-validate_value-type-field_type.description: This filter allows you to perform custom validation on a field’s value and either allow or prevent the post from being saved.

valid.label: valid
valid.description: Whether or not the value is valid (true / false). Can also be returned as a custom error message (string).

field.label: field
field.description: An array containing all the field settings.

acf-validate_value.name: acf/validate_value
acf-validate_value.summary: Perform custom validation on a field's value before it is saved. Filter for every field
acf-validate_value.description: This filter allows you to perform custom validation on a field’s value and either allow or prevent the post from being saved.

valid.label: valid
valid.description: Whether or not the value is valid (true / false). Can also be returned as a custom error message (string).

field.label: field
field.description: An array containing all the field settings.
